tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Hosea the prophet is speaking.

tn.ref: for you have fallen because of your iniquity
tn.text: Sinning is spoken of here as if it were falling. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Take with you words
tn.text: This probably means words of confession and praise. "Confess your sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the fruit of our lips
tn.text: What a person says is called the fruit of his lips. AT: "our words and songs of praise." Modern versions have different translations of this difficult passage. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Hosea is speaking

tn.ref: to the work of our hands
tn.text: "hands" refers to people making things. AT: "to the idols we made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the fatherless person
tn.text: This expression stands perhaps for the entire nation. It indicates God's enormous compassion for his people.

tn.ref: finds compassion
tn.text: Here the act of God having compassion is spoken of as if it were an object that someone experiencing that compassion had found. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh is speaking.

tn.ref: I will heal their turning away
tn.text: Stopping the people from turning away from God is spoken of as if he were healing them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: their turning away
tn.text: The failure of the people to obey God is spoken of as if they had physically turned away from him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will be like the dew to Israel; he will blossom like the lily
tn.text: God is spoken of as if he were dew that brought needed moisture to plants, and Israel is spoken of as if it were one person, and as if he were a flower that could blossom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: and take root like a cedar in Lebanon
tn.text: The picture of Israel in the form of a plant is continued here, but this time in the form of a tall cedar tree in Lebanon, which was known for such trees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: His branches will spread out ... like the cedars in Lebanon
tn.text: This passage continues the same image. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh is speaking.

tn.ref: The people who live in his shade will return
tn.text: The people of Israel will once again live protected by God. Israel is spoken of as living in his shade. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: they will revive like grain and blossom like vines
tn.text: Israel's new prosperity is spoken of in agricultural terms. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: His fame will be like the wine of Lebanon
tn.text: Just as Lebanon's wine was famous, so Israel will be famous. AT: "People everywhere will know about the nation of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: what more have I to do with idols?
tn.text: This passage signifies that God will stop the people of Israel from worshiping idols any longer. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: a cypress whose leaves are always green
tn.text: A cypress is a tree whose leaves stay green all year. This represents Yahweh and his blessings on Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: from me comes your fruit
tn.text: Here "fruit" represents every good thing that comes from Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Hosea the prophet is speaking.

tn.ref: Who is wise that he may understand these things? Who understands these things so that he may know them?
tn.text: The prophet uses these questions to say that wise people will understand and listen to what has been said to them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: For the ways of Yahweh are right, and the righteous will walk in them
tn.text: Yahweh's commandments are spoken of as ways to walk in. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]

tn.ref: stumble
tn.text: Disobeying Yahweh is spoken of as if it were stumbling while walking. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]
